title: Life Expectancy and Population
text:
This is a graph from the dataset, gapminder, using Python code to see the relationship between life expectancy and population.



 #| echo: true
 #| eval: true
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

data = pd.read_csv("gapminder.csv")

plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
plt.scatter(data = data, x = 'life_expectancy', y = 'population_millions')
plt.xlabel('Life Expectancy')
plt.ylabel('Population (Millions)')
plt.title('Life Expectancy vs Population')
# Display the plot
plt.show()

title: Gapminder Dataset
text:
This is a website for a QTM 350 class about the Gapminder dataset, This dataset contains for each of the 142 countries, the package provides values for life expectancy, GDP per capita, and population, every five years, from 1952 to 2007.


Link.

title: Country Analysis
text:
This is a graph from the dataset, gapminder, using Python code to analyse changes in life expectancy, GDP per capita, and population for United States over time.



 #| echo: true
 #| eval: true
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

data = pd.read_csv("gapminder.csv")
us_data = data[data['country'] == 'United States']
# First Graph
plt.subplot(3, 1, 1)
plt.plot(us_data['year'], us_data['life_expectancy'])
plt.ylabel('Life Expectancy (years)')
plt.title('Life Expectancy in United States Over Time')
plt.grid(True)

# Second Graph
plt.subplot(3, 1, 2)
plt.plot(us_data['year'], us_data['gdp_per_capita'])
plt.ylabel('GDP per Capita')
plt.title('GDP per Capita in United States Over Time')
plt.grid(True)

# Third Graph
plt.subplot(3, 1, 3)
plt.plot(us_data['year'], us_data['population_millions'])
plt.ylabel('Population (Millions)')
plt.title('Populations in United States Over Time')
plt.grid(True)

# Display the plot
plt.tight_layout()
plt.show()

title: Country Analysis
text:
This is a graph from the dataset, gapminder, using Python code to analyse changes in life expectancy, GDP per capita, and population for United States over time.



 #| echo: true
 #| eval: true
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

data = pd.read_csv("gapminder.csv")
us_data = data[data['country'] == 'United States']
# First Graph
plt.subplot(3, 1, 1)
plt.plot(us_data['year'], us_data['life_expectancy'])
plt.ylabel('Life Expectancy (years)')
plt.title('Life Expectancy in United States Over Time')
plt.grid(True)

# Second Graph
plt.subplot(3, 1, 2)
plt.plot(us_data['year'], us_data['gdp_per_capita'])

# Third Graph

plt.plot(us_data['year'], us_data['population_millions'])
plt.ylabel('Population (Millions)')
plt.title('Populations in United States Over Time')
plt.grid(True)

# Display the plot
plt.tight_layout()
plt.show()

title: Create the Gapminder dataset
text:
# Import necessary libraries
import pandas as pd
from gapminder import gapminder

# Rename 'lifeExp' to 'life_expectancy' and 'gdpPercap' to 'gdp_per_capita'
gapminder = gapminder.rename(columns={'lifeExp': 'life_expectancy',
                                      'pop': 'population_millions', 
                                      'gdpPercap': 'gdp_per_capita'})

# Convert population to millions
gapminder['population_millions'] = gapminder['population_millions'] / 1_000_000

# Create a new pandas DataFrame from the modified gapminder data
gapminder_df = pd.DataFrame(gapminder)

# Save the DataFrame as a CSV file
gapminder_df.to_csv('gapminder.csv', index=False)

# Print the first 3 rows of the DataFrame
print(gapminder_df.head(3))

1  Afghanistan      Asia  1957           30.332             9.240934   
2  Afghanistan      Asia  1962           31.997            10.267083

title: Graph of Life Expectancy and GDP per Capita
text:
This is a graph from the dataset, gapminder, using Python code to see the relationship between life expectancy and GDP per capita.



 #| echo: true
 #| eval: true
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

data = pd.read_csv("gapminder.csv")

plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
plt.scatter(data = data, x = 'life_expectancy', y = 'gdp_per_capita')
plt.xlabel('Life Expectancy')
plt.ylabel('GDP per Capita')
plt.title('Life Expectancy vs GDP per Capita')
# Display the plot
plt.show()
